Package app

Class MiRideApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.MiRideApplication
  • public class MiRideApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    MiRideApplication is the class responsible for managing all the data that is stored within the system. Most importantly, this class stores Car and Booking objects to be utilized by the program and the user's input.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Peter Bui : s3786794

      • createCar

        public java.lang.String createCar​(java.lang.String carType,
                                  java.lang.String id,
                                  java.lang.String make,
                                  java.lang.String model,
                                  java.lang.String driverName,
                                  int numPassengers,
                                  double bookingFee,
                                  java.lang.String refreshments)
                           throws java.util.InputMismatchException,
                                  InvalidId,
                                  InvalidRefreshments
        Method is responsible for fully creating a Car object to be used by the user within the program.
        Parameters:
        carType - the type that a car is. Takes string input
        id - registration number. Takes string input of chars and numbers
        make - car manufacturer. Takes string input
        model - version of car. Takes string input
        driverName - name of driver. Takes string input
        numPassengers - number of passengers. Takes numeric input
        bookingFee - booking fee of car. Takes numeric input
        refreshments - list of refreshments. Takes string input
        Returns:
        string returns string if either successful or failed.
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - If an input mismatch exception has occurred
        InvalidId - If an invalid id exception has occurred
        InvalidRefreshments - If an invalid refreshments exception has occurred

      • book

        public java.lang.String[] book​(DateTime dateRequired)
        Method is responsible for checking which cars are available based on the date that is required by the user.
        Parameters:
        dateRequired - date required. Takes in a custom DateTime object
        Returns:
        availableCars returns an array of cars that are available for booking.

      • book

        public java.lang.String book​(java.lang.String firstName,
                             java.lang.String lastName,
                             DateTime required,
                             int numPassengers,
                             java.lang.String registrationNumber)
                      throws InvalidBooking,
                             InvalidDate
        Method is responsible for creating a string that shows a Booking object has been successfully created.
        Parameters:
        firstName - user's first name. Takes string input
        lastName - user's last name. Takes string input
        required - date required. Takes DateTime input
        numPassengers - number of passengers. Takes numeric input
        registrationNumber - car registration number. Takes string input
        Returns:
        message Returns a string if booking object is successful or not.
        Throws:
        InvalidBooking - If an invalid booking exception has occurred
        InvalidDate - If an invalid date exception has occurred

      • completeBooking

        public java.lang.String completeBooking​(java.lang.String firstName,
                                        java.lang.String lastName,
                                        DateTime dateOfBooking,
                                        double kilometers)
        Method is responsible for ensuring a Booking object has been completed by user's name, booking date when traveled and kilometers traveled.
        Parameters:
        firstName - user's first name. Takes string input
        lastName - user's last name. Takes string input
        registrationNumber - car registration number. Takes string input
        kilometers - kilometers traveled. Takes numeric input
        Returns:
        Returns string if booking is completed, or booking does not exist.

      • completeBooking

        public java.lang.String completeBooking​(java.lang.String firstName,
                                        java.lang.String lastName,
                                        java.lang.String registrationNumber,
                                        double kilometers)
        Method is responsible for ensuring a Booking object has been completed by user's name, registration number and kilometers traveled.
        Parameters:
        firstName - user's first name. Takes string input
        lastName - user's last name. Takes string input
        registrationNumber - car registration number. Takes string input
        kilometers - kilometers traveled. Takes numeric input
        Returns:
        Returns string if car could not be found, booking is completed, or booking does not exist.

      • getBookingByName

        public boolean getBookingByName​(java.lang.String firstName,
                                java.lang.String lastName,
                                java.lang.String registrationNumber)
        Method is responsible for getting a Booking object from memory given the user's input of their full name and provided registration number.
        Parameters:
        firstName - user's first name. Takes string input
        lastName - user's last name. Takes string input
        registrationNumber - car registration number. Takes string input
        Returns:
        Returns boolean if car could not be found, booking is completed, or booking does not exist.

      • displaySpecificCar

        Parameters:
        regNo - registration number. Takes string input
        Returns:

      • displayAvailable

        public java.lang.String displayAvailable​(java.lang.String type,
                                         DateTime dateInput)
        Method is responsible for displaying available cars based on car type and date inputs. ALGORITHM - Sorting cars by availability BEGIN CHECKS for car type IF either car type CHECKS if there are any cars CHECKS if car is available RETURNS car details IF there are no cars available RETURNS no cars available IF there are no cars RETURNS there are no cars IF not either type RETURN invalid input END
        Parameters:
        type - car type. Takes in string input
        dateInput - date required. Takes in custom DateTime input
        Returns:
        Returns the details of all available cars, or errors if car does not exist.

      • seedData

        public boolean seedData()
                 throws InvalidBooking,
                        InvalidDate,
                        InvalidId,
                        InvalidRefreshments
        Method is responsible for seeding both regular and silver service cars into memory for usage by the user.
        Returns:
        Returns true if cars could be seeded, or false if there's no more memory left for cars to be seeded.
        Throws:
        InvalidBooking - If an invalid booking exception has occurred
        InvalidDate - If an invalid date exception has occurred
        InvalidId - If an invalid id exception has occurred
        InvalidRefreshments - If an invalid refreshments exception has occurred

      • seedRegular

                        InvalidDate,
                        InvalidId
        Method is responsible for seeding regular cars into memory.
        Throws:
        InvalidBooking - If an invalid booking exception has occurred
        InvalidDate - If an invalid date exception has occurred
        InvalidId - If an invalid id exception has occurred

        Returns:

      • printDataExists

        public void printDataExists()
                     throws CorruptedFiles,
                            InvalidId,
                            InvalidRefreshments,
                            java.util.InputMismatchException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            NullFile
        Method is responsible for ensuring placing old Car objects that is already read from an external file into memory.

        CorruptedFiles - If a corrupted files exception has occurred
        InvalidId - If an invalid id exception has occurred
        InvalidRefreshments - If an invalid refreshments exception has occurred
        java.util.InputMismatchException - If an input mismatch exception has occurred
        java.io.IOException - If an input or output exception has occurred
        NullFile - If a null file exception has occurred
